text: Gerald Francis "Jerry" Coleman (September 14, 1924 - January 5, 2014) was an American professional baseball second baseman. He played for the New York Yankees from 1949 to 1957. He managed the San Diego Padres for one year in 1980. He was born in San Jose, California. Coleman died from a brain hemorrhage caused by complications from a fall on January 5, 2014 in San Diego, California. He was 89 years old. He was outlived by his second wife and three children. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1924 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Accidental deaths from falls in the United States Category:Military people from California Category:Baseball players from California Category:Deaths from cerebral hemorrhage Category:New York Yankees players Category:Sportspeople from San Jose, California Category:National Radio Hall of Fame inductees
title: Jerry Coleman
